sentences.sContent: Mr. Obama is the first president since Richard M. Nixon to be elected while living in a city neighborhood, in his case, Chicago’s racially and economically diverse Hyde Park.
sentences.sContent_eng: Mr. Obama is the first president since Richard M. Nixon to be elected while living in a city neighborhood, in his case, Chicago’s racially and economically diverse Hyde Park.
sentences.sCn: 奥巴马是自理查德.尼克松总统以来第一位住在城市社区中当选的总统，奥巴马住在芝加哥种族和经济多元化的海德公园。

sentences.sContent: Despite his criticism of Wright's racially-tinged comments over the years, Obama said he will not disown his former minister.
sentences.sContent_eng: Despite his criticism of Wright's racially-tinged comments over the years, Obama said he will not disown his former minister.
sentences.sCn: 尽管他批评了赖特多年来富有种族色彩的评论，奥巴马说，他不会抛弃他过去的牧师。

sentences.sContent: ...while racially restrictive agreements largely prevented them from buying into the suburban neighborhoods being built for white working-class families...

words.tran: 种族主义，种族歧视；人种偏见
种族主义；种族歧视；人种偏见
